Turned out that conversion factor on encoder velocity was not being set (RPM != m/s !). Crazy high values were being passed to motors as a result. Don’t know if this applies to your situation, so just a FYI.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2023-02-11T21:16:26.638Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":83,"readers_count":82,"score":21.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":426508,"topic_slug":"robot-going-backwards-and-forwards-repetitively-in-short-intervals","display_username":"Jeff Young","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56644,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/robot-going-backwards-and-forwards-repetitively-in-short-intervals/426508/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3144127,"name":"Abi","username":"thesteminist","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thesteminist/{size}/179827_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-12T13:13:45.853Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eAssuming you’re using dual-motor drivetrain gearboxes, would be worth a check to make sure that the two motors on each gearbox are turning the same direction relative to each other. The rapid back and forth can result from the two motors fighting each other, especially if the movement is small in either direction.
